title: 'Hold guardians responsible for juvenile driving'
text: Parliamentary panel supports higher fine for traffic offences Feb 8, 2017, 03.07PM IST Dipak K Dash ] NEW DELHI: Paving the way for early passage of amenents to Motor Vehicles Act, a parliamentary panel has recommended higher penalty for traffic offences including holding guardians responsible for juvenile driving.The standing committee on transport and tourism submitted its report in Rajya Sabha on Wednesday.The panel has recommended treating deaths due to drunken driving as "culpable homicide" and had also suggested formulating laws to limit the acceleration capability of vehicles to the speed limit prescribed in India and in accordance with the available infrastructure.The panel has noted that while speed limits on Indian roads is 80 kmph and highways are designed for 120 kmph, many vehicles have acceleration capability up to 240 kmph.The committee has also given general recommendations to make roads safe, which include not allowing guns in private vehicles to prevent road rage, including traffic and road safety education in school curriculum. It has recommended strict implementation of duty hours for drivers and prohibit driving of commercial vehicles during 3 to 5 am. The committee has suggested restricting the movement of heavy vehicles during early morning.
